channel.title: Prestige Mode
channel.description: Many of us have played Call of Duty 4 and I was wondering about an idea that is possible to make. What do you people think about me making a server feature or a "tutorial" where you rank up in a number of specific skills (such as all 3 melee skills) or max all your skills out all the way. Then, a message pops up saying, "Congratulations, you are now legible for Prestige Mode, click the next button to continue." The next menu would probably say something like, "Prestige Mode is a very rewarding system, allowing you to show off your achievements, but be aware, entering Prestige Mode will reset your [certain] stats.". Then, if you agreed to enter Prestige Mode, by typing in some command listed on the next page of the interface, you would now have a Prestige icon next to your player name. Like how administrators and moderators have a crown next to their names, you would have a prestige icon that differs on your prestige level. This could easily be implemented, but I am not entirely sure on making about 9 prestige sprites. I just wanted to know what people thought or if I was just having a crazy thought.

item.title: Prestige Mode
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Sure. Sounds pretty good actually, if you want I can help!

Read full topic

item.title: Prestige Mode
item.dc:creator: @Call_of_Duty Call of Duty
item.description:
@Call_of_Duty wrote:

Many of us have played Call of Duty 4 and I was wondering about an idea that is possible to make. Then, if you agreed to enter Prestige Mode, by typing in some command listed on the next page of the interface, you would now have a Prestige icon next to your player name. Like how administrators and moderators have a crown next to their names, you would have a prestige icon that differs on your prestige level. This could easily be implemented, but I am not entirely sure on making about 9 prestige sprites. I just wanted to know what people thought or if I was just having a crazy thought.
